sentence: Share price of Coty Inc.COTY reached a new 52-week high of $31.29 on Jun 16.

Shares moved north on a New York Post report - published on Jun 15 - which stated that three of The Procter & Gamble Company's PG beauty businesses have been auctioned to Coty for $12 billion Shares of the cosmetics company have yielded a year-to-date return of 52.1%.

Purchase of Three Beauty Businesses from P&G

Coty is reportedly said to have outbid other potential buyers during an auction to sell P&G's hair care, fragrant and cosmetics businesses.
The deal has not yet been finalized and both the companies are yet to issue official statements.
However, on completion of the deal, Coty is expected to become one of the leading fragrances and color cosmetics company in the global market.
Coty has a market cap of $9.39 billion.
Coty, which has been acquiring several brands for years, will particularly benefit from this deal.
P&G's $12 billion worth of Beauty businesses will offer Coty a huge potential for growth in the global cosmetics market and will strengthen its foothold in U.S.
The addition of P&G's perfume brands will be a strategic fit for Coty's perfume portfolio, which already includes perfume for fashion brands Calvin Klein and Marc Jacobs.
Moreover, the Wella and Clairol brands will mark its entry into the hair care category.
Coty's sales have been soft for the past few quarters.
The deal should boost the company's revenues in the long term.
Better-ranked stocks in the industry include Helen of Troy Limited HELE and Inter Parfums Inc. IPAR .
While Helen of Troy sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Inter Parfums hold a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
